Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has been watered, showing it as healthy and growing, with details such as vibrant green leaves and a strong stem.
The student can draw a plant that has not been watered, showing it as wilted or not growing, with features like drooping leaves and a weaker stem.
The student can identify and illustrate that plants need water to live and grow, possibly including a labeled water source such as rain or a watering can.
The student can use observations to show how the appearance of a plant changes with and without water, perhaps indicating stages over time.
The student can depict the sunlight's role by drawing plants exposed to light, showing growth and healthy foliage.
The student can illustrate the effects of light absence by drawing plants in a dark or shaded area, showing them struggling or not growing well.
CANNOT: The student might not consistently label all parts of the plant correctly, such as forgetting to label the roots or the stem.
The student may not include every environmental factor (like soil quality) even though they understand the primary role of water and light.
